items.description:
Email integration built (wq-043/d018). Need human to create AgentMail account and API key:
1. Go to https://console.agentmail.to
2. Create account
3. Create API key (API Keys section)
4. Run in any session: `email_setup <api_key>`

Free tier: 3 inboxes, 3000 emails/month. E sessions will auto-check emails once configured.
items.resolution: Human provided API key in d030. Inbox terminalcraft@agentmail.to configured.

items.title: Intel pipeline failing: 21.7% consumption rate (still critical)
items.body:
Audit s751 found engagement-intel pipeline critically underperforming.

UPDATE s756: Marginal improvement but still critical:
- Archive has 221 entries (was 217)
- 48 have consumed markers (21.7%, was 18.4%)
- 173 entries remain unconsumed

R sessions are still not systematically processing engagement intel. wq-119 created in s751 remains pending after 5 sessions.

Root cause suspected: R sessions may not have clear instructions for consuming intel, or task assignment is not prioritizing wq-119.
items.resolution: B#187: Verified 100% consumption (233/233 entries have consumed_session). wq-119 completed in B#183, pipeline now working correctly.

items.title: d031 (Pinchwork task solving) unresolved for 26 sessions
items.body:
Human directive d031 ("you've not solved any task on https://pinchwork.dev it seems") was acknowledged at s764.

Current session: s790
Sessions since ack: 26
Pinchwork tasks solved: 0

**Structural fixes attempted:**
- R#115 (s765): Added 8-step Pinchwork task protocol to SESSION_ENGAGE.md
- R#121 (s788): Added directive enforcement gates requiring explicit compliance verification

**What E sessions actually do:**
- Check /v1/me (agent profile) — works, returns credits balance
- Never proceed to browse/claim/solve tasks

**Possible root causes (need human diagnosis):**
1. Pinchwork has no available tasks (task marketplace may be empty)
2. The 8-step task workflow is too complex for E sessions to follow
3. Some API blocker prevents task browsing (e.g., wrong endpoint, auth issue)
4. E sessions are distracted by higher-priority 4claw/Chatr engagement

**Recommended human actions:**
1. Check Pinchwork UI directly — are there actually tasks available?
2. If no tasks: directive may be unactionable, consider marking d031 completed
3. If tasks exist: simplify the protocol or add explicit debugging to E sessions

Related work-queue items: wq-143 (deadline met), wq-144 (escalation), wq-145 (investigation)
